resources.string: Android offers several buttons to leave apps, Back to finish and return previous app, Home or Overview to move background; and Android allows some apps to run as service, which keeps running. Of course, you can swipe away from recent apps via Overview button.\n\nBrevent distinguish whether apps were started or finished, then brevent not-in-use apps from running long time. Furthermore, Brevent will force-stop apps awaken by other apps.

When pressing Back to finish apps, apps including services won\'t be running anymore; when pressing Home or Overview or other way to move apps background, background apps including services can keep running; when swiping from recent tasks, apps will be force-stopped.\n\nFor background apps, Brevent shows the idle time dynamically.
When you turn on the device, Brevent requires you to run a command in debugging mode to acquire necessary permissions.

Some similar apps require ROOT or modify unlocked devices. The debugging mode doesn\'t require ROOT, nor unlock, it\'s safe to use.\n\nIf your device has been ROOTed, you can run as ROOT to skip debugging mode. ROOT mode is unsafe and unnessary, and requires donation.
Brevent requires Brevent server to be launched in debugging mode. However, debugging mode is not safe, it\'s recommended to turn off after Brevent server is running.
Brevent use many Android\'s hide API, may not work on your device. Some third-party ROM may modify these API, there are potential risks to use Brevent.
Enjoy Brevent, and feel free to feedback.

The default Brevent method is Standby. If you find some apps still running, please use Brevent or other tools to check whether it\'s Standby.\n\nAnd to reduce self battery usage, Brevent sever delay the processes by 3 to 60 seconds according the event level. However, you can modify it to immediate in settings.

1. Turn on "Developer options", enable "USB debugging" %1$s

2. Connect to PC via USB

3. Execute in PC's command line: %2$s (Copied to clipboard)
Update Brevent list when apps installed or uninstalled
Some apps move to background when Back is pressed. When on, Brevent treat it as normal Back (Available since Android 7.0)
Some apps open Home when Back is pressed. When on, Brevent treat it as normal Back. Brevent could distinguish in most case, however you can press Home 7 times to help Brevent confirm
Background apps will be brevented after %s. Brevent show inactive time for background apps dynamically
Background apps won\'t be brevented. Brevent show inactive time for background apps dynamically
App Standby when exit apps, and ForceStop when swiping away from recent tasks\n\nOnly apply to non-background apps, for background apps, please refer to "Background apps timeout"
Only App Standby, no ForceStop. Of course, will ForceStop apps awaken by other apps\n\nOnly apply to non-background apps, for background apps, please refer to "Background apps timeout"
Only ForceStop, no App Standby. It may save battery, but costs more time when apps re-launch\n\nOnly apply to non-background apps, for background apps, please refer to "Background apps timeout"

Later. Short when Home focused, longer when awaken, longest when apps focused, immediately when screen off\n\nOnly apply to non-background apps, for background apps, please refer to "Background apps timeout"

Immediate. Whenever apps / Home focused, screen off, awaken by other apps. Be careful, Brevent server will consume more battery, other apps may not work well\n\nOnly apply to non-background apps, for background apps, please refer to "Background apps timeout"
Please donate in Play Store to hide donation
Thanks for donation %d USD in Play Store
Thanks for donation %1$d times total %2$d USD in Play Store
Include system and framework apps cannot be open
All apps have the same signature with framework
Thanks for feedback.\n\nIf you have a GitHub account, please create an issue; you can view opened issues too.%s
\n\nFor private messages, please drop an Email to me.
This feature allow brevented apps to receive GCM message\n\nRecommend donate total 1 USD in Play Store

If WeChat receives GCM in stop state, it has no notification. This feature never force-stop WeChat (won\'t apply when swiping from recent list), so it may push notification when receiving GCM message\n\nRecommend donate total 1 USD in Play Store

It\'s unsafe and unnecessary for Brevent to use ROOT. If your device has been ROOTed, this feature can start Brevent service without USB Debugging\n\nRequires donate total 3 USD in Play Store. No restriction if Play Store is unavailable
